definition: leaving a rich aftertaste/(fig.) memorable/lingering in memory
to circle/to go back/to turn around/to answer/to return/to revolve/Hui ethnic group (Chinese Muslims)/time/classifier for acts of a play/section or chapter (of a classic book)
taste/smell/(fig.) (noun suffix) feel/quality/sense/(TCM) classifier for ingredients of a medicine prescription
not to have/no/none/not/to lack/un-/-less
poor/destitute/to use up/to exhaust/thoroughly/extremely/(coll.) persistently and pointlessly

sentences.english: With flavor and aroma of baking, after drinking halls.
sentences.chinese: 帶焙火的韻味與香氣，飲後令人回味無窮。

sentences.english: The local dishes are robust and challenging, featuring mainly pork.
sentences.chinese: 地方菜口味濃重，令人回味無窮，以豬肉主料爲特色。

sentences.english: Balanced by crisp acidity for a long and memorable finish.
sentences.chinese: 酸度清脆平衡，餘味悠長，回味無窮。

sentences.english: Such feeling is just meaningful, yet endless in aftertaste.
sentences.chinese: 這種感覺還是比較有味，且回味無窮。

sentences.english: Soft, fleshy and long palate with cherry-jam notes.
sentences.chinese: 柔順，新鮮爽潔，回味無窮的櫻桃果醬。

sentences.english: Besides, good Australian red wine will add even more luster a nd leave infinite joy in the aftertaste.
sentences.chinese: 另配上等的澳洲紅酒，回味無窮，意猶未盡。

sentences.english: They are all the memorable gifts.
sentences.chinese: 它們都是你回味無窮的禮物。

sentences.english: It led me to endless aftertastes.
Money has no memory. Experience has.
sentences.chinese: 金錢沒有任何記憶，然而體驗卻讓你回味無窮。

definition: unforgettable
want to stop but can't (idiom)/to be unable to stop oneself/to feel an urge to continue
rich/strong/heavy (fragrance)/dense/full-bodied/intense
exquisite
thought-provoking/worth thinking over/to provide food for thought
to wish to continue sth/to have not fully expressed oneself
to read smoothly (of text)/to blurt out (without thinking)/to suit one's taste (of food)
long and continuous (coastline, sound etc)/extensive/prolonged
to be amazed/to be surprised/to wonder
al dente
to taste a small amount/to sample
stunning/breathtaking
to satisfy a craving/to get a kick out of sth/gratifying/immensely enjoyable/satisfying/fulfilling
strong fragrance/pungent
to love sth too much to part with it (idiom); to fondle admiringly
delicious/tasty
